member.name: P:Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.Code.KanaMode
member.summary: KanaMode (カタカナ/ひらがな/ローマ字)

member.name: T:Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.Exclude
member.summary: The flags of HTML element that will be not allowed hotkey works.

member.name: T:Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.HotKeyDownEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the KeyDown eventsof HotKeys service.

member.name: P:Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.HotKeyDownEventArgs.Modifiers
member.summary: Get the combination of modifier keys flags.

member.name: P:Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.HotKeyDownEventArgs.Key
member.summary:
Get the value of the "key" property in the HTML Keyboard event object, that taking into consideration the state of modifier keys such as Shift as well as the keyboard locale and layout.
(https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/key/Key_Values)

member.name: P:Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.HotKeyDownEventArgs.Code
member.summary:
Get the value of the "code" property in the HTML Keyboard event object, that represents a physical key on the keyboard.
(https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent/code/code_values)

member.name: P:Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.HotKeyDownEventArgs.SrcElementTagName
member.summary: Get the tag name of HTML element that is source of the DOM event.

member.name: P:Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.HotKeyDownEventArgs.SrcElementTypeAttribute
member.summary: Get the type attribute, if any, of the HTML element that is source of the DOM event.

member.name: P:Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.HotKeyDownEventArgs.IsWasm
member.summary: Get the runtime environment is on a WebAssembly (Web browser), or not.

member.name: P:Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.HotKeyDownEventArgs.PreventDefault
member.summary:
Get or set the flag to determine prevent default behavior or not.
[IMPORTANT NOTICE] When set this property to true on a Blazor Server App (not a WebAssembly app), will be thrown.
("PreventDefault" behavior is not supported on Blazor Server App.)

member.name: M:Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.HotKeyEntry.ToString
member.summary: Returns a String that combined key combination and description of this entry, like "Ctrl+A: Select All."
member.returns: A string that represents the key combination and description of this entry.

member.name: M:Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.HotKeyEntry.ToString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a String formatted with specified format string.
member.param: {0} will be replaced with key combination text, and {1} will be replaced with description of this hotkey entry object.
member.returns: A string formatted with the specified format string.

member.summary: Returns an array of String formatted keys.

member.name: M:Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.HotKeysContext.Remove(Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.Key,System.String,Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.Exclude,System.String)
member.summary:
Remove a hotkey entriy from this context.
If the parameter cannot find any hotkey entry, this method will return without exception.
If only one hotkey entry can be identified by the parameter, it will be removed even if the other parameters are not matched.
If the parameter identifies two or more hotkey entries, the other parameters are referenced to identify the single hotkey entry to be removed.
If the parameters can not determine a single hotkey entry, the exception will be thrown.
member.param: The identifier of hotkey.
The description of the meaning of this hot key entry.
The combination of HTML element flags that will be not allowed hotkey works.
Additional CSS selector for HTML elements that will not allow hotkey to work.

member.name: M:Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.HotKeysContext.Remove(Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.ModKey,Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.Key,System.String,Toolbelt.Blazor.HotKeys2.Exclude,System.String)
member.summary:
Remove a hotkey entriy from this context.
If the combination of the and the parameters cannot find any hotkey entry, this method will return without exception.
If only one hotkey entry can be identified by the combination of the and the parameters, it will be removed even if the other parameters are not matched.
If the combination of the and the parameters identifies two or more hotkey entries, the other parameters are referenced to identify the single hotkey entry to be removed.
If the parameters can not determine a single hotkey entry, the exception will be thrown.
member.param: The combination of modifier keys flags.
The identifier of hotkey.
The description of the meaning of this hot key entry.
The combination of HTML element flags that will be not allowed hotkey works.
Additional CSS selector for HTML elements that will not allow hotkey to work.
